House Bill/Resolution NO. HB08406
FULL TITLE : AN ACT ESTABLISHING RESOURCE CENTERS FOR INDIGENOUS CULTURAL COMMUNITIES/INDIGENOUS PEOPLES TO ENHANCE AND ENSURE DELIVERY OF ESSENTIAL SERVICES, APPROPRIATING FUNDS THEREFOR AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
ABSTRACT : Aims to supplement the shortcomings of the IPRA law (R.A. No. 8371) because our IPs continually remain among the poor and marginalized sectors of our society; basic services remain deficient in geographically isolated and extreme areas (GIDAs); and reports of serious violations of their rights, their displacement from the ancestral lands, the environmental degradation, and cultural teardown still abound. Provides that resource centers for IPs shall be ethnographically located, gender and rights based, and shall constitute service areas as Statistical Service Area, Human Development Index Service Area and Domains Management Service Area.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : ALEJANO, GARY C.
DATE FILED : 2018-10-09
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
